In India there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand. What do you think are the major steps that can be taken by the government to improve patient care in the country? 
                                    Doctors are considered as next to God. They are considered as life savers. And so it becomes very important for them to take every care in medication and give their best to suppoprt life. Unfortunately the healthcare in India is not much developed. There is a wide range of difficulty faced by the sufferers to get themselves medicated even during emergencies, most often in governament hospitals.

                                              Each and every minute counts in an healthcare industry. At one second we find ourself facing hell already and the very next secoond we are safe. Such are the miracles that happen here and so its very important to develop and maintain it properly. The bad conditions and delayed process in healthcare can take away one's precious life. This shows how time management, experimented procedures, proper medications,etc counts in this industry.

                                              Every day the proportion of death rate  is getting higher than the birth rate. Many reasons account for this and one such is no proper hospitality.There are many hospitals where still there is lack of staff. We find only few of them taking up the entire task. Many hospitals lack efficient doctors with good masters, loosing the confidence of their clients. The following steps should be taken to equate the supply and demand of healthcare:

1) Ensure evrey area has atleast two hospitals so that it becomes quick and easy for medication.

2) The procedures adopted before consulting the doctor should be lessend.

3) Every  department in a hospital must be headed by two specialist so that one can take up the other in his absence.

4) They should be supported by considerable number of juniors to ease the process.

5) Staff must be trained with First Aid to avoid damage.

6) First Aid education should be made mandatory.

7) Clenliness is next to Godliness. Many hospitals are not maintained causing uncomfortableness to the patient. A regular check should be done to ensure hygiene conditions are being maintained by the hospitals.

8) Government should support and ensure that every hospital adopts the new techniques and procedures for excellent healthcare.

                                         These are few steps that should be taken to improve the patient care and serve the people on time.
